drop table dbo.ErrorLog

-- Create the ErrorLog table without a default constraint on ErrorTimestamp
CREATE TABLE ErrorLog
(
    ErrorID INT IDENTITY(1,1),
    TableName NVARCHAR(50),
    ErrorDescription NVARCHAR(250),
    RecordID INT,
    ErrorTimestamp DATETIME  -- Removed DEFAULT GETDATE() constraint
);

-- Check for invalid ProductID in Staging_Sales
SELECT * FROM staggingSales
WHERE ProductID NOT IN (SELECT ProductID FROM staggingProduct);

-- Handle inconsistent data by logging or moving to an error table
INSERT INTO ErrorLog (TableName, ErrorDescription, RecordID, ErrorTimestamp)
SELECT 'dbo.staggingSales', 'Invalid ProductID', SalesID, GETDATE()  -- Explicitly include GETDATE() for ErrorTimestamp
FROM staggingSales
WHERE ProductID NOT IN (SELECT ProductID FROM staggingProduct);
